./

faxen__define.pro


Calculate the velocity, $\vec{v}(\vec{r})$, of a sphere of radius $a$ at position(s) $\vec{r}$ within a hydrodynamic flow, $\vec{u}(\vec{r})$.

The velocity is computed according to Faxen's first law: $$\vec{v}(\vec{r}) = \vec{u}(\vec{r}) + \frac{a^2}{6} \, \nabla^2 \vec{u}$$

Author information

Author

David G. Grier, New York University

Copyright

Copyright (c) 2015 David G. Grier

Class description for faxen

Inheritance

  • IDL_OBJECT

Properties

Properties in faxen

flow get set init

Object reference to a flowfield object defining the hydrodynamic flow, $\vec{u}(\vec{r})$.

radius get set init

Radius $a$ of the sphere in meters.

Fields in faxen

flow obj_new()

Object reference to a flowsource or flowfield that creates a hydrodynamic flow $\vec{u}(\vec{r})$ around the sphere.

radius 0.00000

Radius of the sphere $a$ in meters.

Routines

Routines from faxen__define.pro

result = faxen::Compute(r)

Calculate the velocity of the sphere at a specified set of points within the flow according to Faxen's first law: $$\vec{v}(\vec{r}) = \vec{u}(\vec{r}) + \frac{a^2}{6} \, \nabla^2 \vec{u}$$

result = faxen::Compute(r)

Calculate the velocity of the sphere at a specified set of points within the flow according to Faxen's first law: $$\vec{v}(\vec{r}) = \vec{u}(\vec{r}) + \frac{a^2}{6} \, \nabla^2 \vec{u}$$
